name: Space/Memory & Intensity
description:
This work is inspired by my personal space and depicts the figure of a mother who is seen as a subject, and responds to the present time as an object of space that is not only seen as a place, but also re-examines the repetitions of personal space itself, such as a house. the house is not only seen as a place to pass by, but far from it the house represents identity for each individual, the house can be defined simply and abstractly, because in it there is a sublimation between love and affection, body and soul, constructed memory, patterns of repetitions, incident and experiences, emotions and a material object that is present home, family, animals, plants, and friends are homes, and it is possible that I and all of us are homes for other people.

I redefine and rethink that personal space, by categorizing an event, and the repeating pattern of events from the spaces that are widely used to interact, as a starting point for winning visuals, and freezing an incident. and bubbles represent freezing, when things get really fast, there are times when we have to stop for a moment, and redefine the meaning of home.

This work uses oil paint in combination with acrylic paint on 40x40 cm canvas, for the initial process I used the underpainting technique.

©️2021 | 1433x1421px | .Gif
